I can't progress to the next stage by using the space bar..the little pink light is on in the staging section I can't unlock it...How do you Unlock it?

**Edited <time datetime="2015-08-01T16:50:47Z" title="08/01/2015 04:50  PM" data-short="8 yr">August 1, 2015</time> by Claw**

pressing ALT+L (Windows), linux? Thats the stage toggle combination ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif), prevents you from unplanned staging events.

And welcome to crazy KSP community!

It may happen that when you undock a ship, stage doesn't work even if it's not locked. You need to create a new stage and move all the next stage action to the new stage, then move the new stage to the right order, then you can space it.
Staging is also locked out when your cursor is over in the staging area on the left of the screen.
Thanks guys..I worked it out ..it was the pesky ALT + L

Jesus, there is stagelock in the game? Been playing for 2 years with over a thousand hours. I never knew that.

Thank you for the birthday present!

I'm in KSP right now and  I'm doing alt+L and nothing happens... HELP! I never even locked it in the first place!

Oh hah.... went to alt+f12 menu and cleared input locks, staging has never been better! Disregard message above

- Are you in timewarp? You cannot stage in on-rails timewarp. (You *can* stage in physics timewarp, which is the 2x, 3x, 4x mode you get inside an atmosphere.)
- Does pressing Alt+L change the staging light color/behavior, or is really nothing happening at all?
- Do you have an input lock? Press Alt+F12 to open the debug menu, go to input locks, and press the clear button. See if anything changes after that.
- Do you actually still have a stage remaining that could trigger? You may want your spacecraft to separate, but if you didn't correctly configure it in the editor...
- Does anything change if you quicksave (F5) and reload (F9)?
- Are you running any mods?
